page.title: 20NEW TECHNOLOGY IN CULWORTH
page.content: In 1980 school children in Culworth were visited by parents to show them what computers looked like.Some children visited the home of Mr Walker a local accountant who had begun to use a computer in his work.In 1985 ,the majority of older children and about half of the younger children have at least 1 computer in their homes.They are mostly used for playing games.At least one parent markets computers abroad.Mr walker's business now an Accounting and Data Processing Service relies heavily on the use of computer control.One parent markets lasers,one travels the world as air crew and one speaks to other nations via radio link. This small,apparently sleepy village is certainly part of C20.Children,Teachers Parents and Friends of Culworth CE Primary School send greetings of PEACE to all who read this,wherever,whenever.
